answers.answer: I'm 36 weeks and this is happening to me as well. I'm not sure how to stop it but I know with me just laying in a hot bath with my feet up has been helping me. Don't know if that could help or not. I hope you find something that's helps for you.
Did they test u for pre-eclampsia? I know swollen limbs can be a sign of that. Do u have any other symptom? Or maybe diabetes?
And also I heard that at the end of pregnancy ur body normally swells up because of water retention, but surprisingly the only cure for that is water. Idk just thoughts and ideas♡ hope u r ok.
They've tested me and they said I'm fine. Hopefully it goes away soon :)

question: Im 37 weeks and my feet have been so swollen that I can't wear shoes. It's getting so bad that I can barely wear sandals now. I talked to my doctor about it and he said its normal but it's been like this for 3 weeks now. I've tried massaging them, elevating, walking, sitting down, cutting salt and drinking water but nothing's working. My legs are now getting swollen too and I don't know what to do. Please help
title: Severely swollen feet and legs
